item.title: Stephanie Boluk and Patrick LeMieux: Hands Free: A History of Accessible Alt Ctrls |Sept. 23
item.description: This presentation begins with a brisk survey of the history of hands-free video game interfaces before comparing and contrasting two devices that articulate two different design philosophies: the NES Hands Free and the Octopad. Rather than thinking about accessibility as a single-player problem, these controllers engage the social, political, and environmental aspects of video games to change the way we play. Join us on September 23 at 4:30pm on Webex.

item.title: EARN YOUR Mercer X Skills Badges
item.description: The Mercer XLab is now offering a chance to earn limited edition Fall 2025 Skills Badges! To improve your Mercer X Skill Set there are three levels to obtain: Level 1 is your learning, Level 2 is applying your learning to a project, and Level 3, the gold standard, is teaching someone else! We offer the opportunity to earn PCB Pro (printing PCB prototypes), PCB Designer, Hot Worker (soldering), Spice-EE (Spice simulation), Instrument Wiz, and IC Designer skills. Earn yours before they run out!

item.title: National Hazing Prevention Week | Sept. 22-26
item.description: Date: Monday, September 22, 2025 - Fri , September 26, 2025 (all day) - RPI Won’t Stand By! September 22nd - September 26th is National Hazing Prevention Week. Multiple areas of campus will be hosting events to build community, uplift healthy groups, and raise awareness to prevent hazing. Stop by one or more of our events! For more information, contact Lauryn Maleski or Mel Daley.

item.title: Cable Television Outage in Specific Campus Buildings
item.description: Multimedia Services would like to inform the campus about an issue affecting CATV services in several buildings: Sage, Troy, Ricketts, and 87Gym. Our service provider has identify the issue–an underground cable–and will implement repairs as soon as possible. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and appreciate patience as we work toward a resolution. New information will be provided as soon as it becomes available. Thank you for your understanding.

item.title: Mainstreaming Mental Well-being: A Training Series for Faculty and Staff
item.description: The Mainstreaming Mental Wellbeing (MMWB) Taskforce envisions an RPI community in which mental health and well-being are central tenets, both in and out of the classroom, and where all community members are challenged and supported to learn, grow, and develop. This training series will give you concrete knowledge, skills, and resources to play an active role in supporting student wellbeing at RPI.

item.title: Rensselaer Faculty and Staff Quick Learn Webinar - Creating Basic Pivot Tables with Excel for Windows | Oct. 3
item.description: Date: Friday, October 3, 2025 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Do you work with data in Excel? Are you always manipulating the content with filters and sorting? If so, taking a look at Pivot Tables in Excel could be beneficial. This workshops will focus on using Pivot Tables in Excel to summarize, filter and group data. Basic functions will be applied as well as a quick look at charts. Please register using the Event URL in the See section of the calendar event.
